Title: Snap geometries to layer
Abstract:
Snaps the geometries in a layer. Snapping can be done either to the geometries from another layer, or to geometries within the same layer.

A tolerance is specified in layer units to control how close vertices need to be to the reference layer geometries before they are snapped.

Snapping occurs to both nodes and edges. Depending on the snapping behavior, either nodes or edges will be preferred.

Vertices will be inserted or removed as required to make the geometries match the reference geometries.

Available values.0: Prefer aligning nodes, insert extra vertices where required

Available values.1: Prefer closest point, insert extra vertices where required

Available values.2: Prefer aligning nodes, don't insert new vertices

Available values.3: Prefer closest point, don't insert new vertices

Available values.4: Move end points only, prefer aligning nodes

Available values.5: Move end points only, prefer closest point

Available values.6: Snap end points to end points only

Available values.7: Snap to anchor nodes (single layer only)

Accepted data types.str: as string representation of int, e.g. '1'
'memory:' to store result in temporary memory layer
using vector provider ID prefix and destination URI, e.g. 'postgres:…' to store result in PostGIS table
